Description: Weight: third-dīnār. Five line inscription on obverse and one line marginal and two line central inscription on reverse. Dot below central legend. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: See also OA+ 4238 and 1885,1007.1. From the same pair of dies: Petrie, W.M.F. 1926. ‘Glass stamps and weights’. London, 167; Miles, G.C. 1948. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps’. New York, 80; Fahmi, A. 1957. ‘Sinaj al-sikka fī fajr al-Islām’. Cairo, 146-7. The reverse die is also the same as that of 1887,1005.12 but is in a later state distinguishable by the addition of a dot below the legend.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (237)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Yazīd b. Ḥātim
Named in inscription: 'Abd al-Raḥmān b. Yazīd
